intro: Alloplectus setosus, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Alloplectus setosus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
